#Text=Make Your Apartment Eco‐Friendly
#Text=Renovating your apartment ?
#Text=Replacing old furniture with new polished pieces and buying new articles for your place ?
#Text=Why not take a more natural approach and transform your apartment into an eco-friendly space ?
#Text=Follow the steps given below to make your living unit eco-friendly .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Renovating an Apartment
#Text=Use good quality doors and windows .
#Text=When you are buying an apartment , make sure that it has high-quality doors and windows .
#Text=Otherwise , they will allow passage of air when even they are closed .
#Text=This means that the heating and cooling appliances in your home will utilize more energy .
#Text=Therefore , do n't compromise on the quality of doors and windows and save yourself money in the long run .
#Text=Choose a good insulation system .
#Text=The better your apartment is insulated , the more energy and money you will save .
#Text=Look for a programmable thermostat , which will keep the living space warm or cool depending on your presence .
#Text=A programmable thermostat will switch on the cooling and heating appliances only when you are back in your apartment .
#Text=If you are unsure about which product you should buy , do some research online or enquire in the local electronics shop .
#Text=Re-use .
#Text=If you plan on removing entire walls or joining two rooms , see what you can salvage .
#Text=Using parts that have been removed is a great way to save the environment and your money .
#Text=You can re-use everything from floorboards to tiles .
#Text=Instead of throwing them away , give them a twist by adding them to another room or furniture piece .
#Text=Buy low VOC paints . VOCs are ' Volatile Organic Compounds ' that release harmful , volatile compounds into the air , posing long-term health effects .
#Text=Using VOC-free or low-VOC paints will ensure a healthier environment .
#Text=Use salvaged wood and metal .
#Text=Using recycled or salvaged wood is a great way to give old material new life , and your apartment a new look .
#Text=It 's environmentally savvy and gives your home a personality of its own .
#Text=If you are buying an under-construction apartment , you can ask the developer to use recycled wood and metal in kitchen countertops , window panes , doors , and shelves .
#Text=Design with recycled glass .
#Text=Using recycled glass is not just helping mother nature , but it 's also helping your apartment look stylish .
#Text=It is excellent material to use for making countertops and even gives your apartment that icy , cracked atmosphere , which is always elegant .
#Text=Put even sunlight to work .
#Text=A great way to go au natural is to install solar panels while re-doing your apartment .
#Text=They wo n't just save you big bucks on your electricity bill , but will also give your apartment . that sleek , fancy look that everyone admires .
#Text=When you 're residing in an apartment , it might be difficult to install solar panels since you need to seek permission from other residents .
#Text=However , you can talk to them about the advantage of using solar panels and how it will help them save money .
#Text=Once you have convinced them , you can ask the builder to install solar panels in the building .
#Text=Use bamboo and cork .
#Text=Bamboo and cork are the perfect replacements for hardwood flooring .
#Text=Not only are they durable , but they also give your apartment a natural and tranquil appearance .
#Text=If you 're thinking cork is flimsy , that 's just the ones on wine bottles .
#Text=The material used for cork flooring is taken from the bark of an oak tree , which can be done without cutting the tree .
#Text=Opt for dual-flush toilets .
#Text=These toilets are low on water-consumption as they offer two flush options .
#Text=One for dry waste and one for liquid waste .
#Text=These toilets can help you save upto 80 % on your toilet water consumption .
#Text=Install rainwater harvesting systems and tankless water heaters .
#Text=When you are making your apartment eco friendly , consider installing a rainwater harvesting system .
#Text=This will help you save water by collecting rainwater from roofs and then storing it in a tank .
#Text=Tankless water heaters save energy costs by only heating the amount of water that is needed .
#Text=However , before you install rainwater harvesting systems and tankless water heaters , do seek permission from other residents and the builder or owner .
#Text=Repair leaking taps and cover holes in the walls .
#Text=There is no use of installing a thermostat or an insulating system if there are tiny holes in your kitchen wall or ceiling .
#Text=There will still be a loss of energy and this will actually cost you more .
#Text=So , cover all the holes .
#Text=Also , fix all leaking taps in your apartment .
#Text=You may think that there is just a small leakage but that could result in the loss of several litres of water .
#Text=Therefore , take steps to make your home completely leak-proof .
#Text=Living Eco-Friendly in Your Apartment
#Text=Adjust cooling and heating temperatures .
#Text=Electronic appliance like refrigerators and freezers utilize more energy than you realize .
#Text=Set your refrigerator at 2.78 degree celsius and the freezer at -19.44 degree celsius to minimize energy consumption .
#Text=Additionally , remember to shut the refrigerator and freezer door properly .
#Text=Leaving them open for a long time will result in a tremendous loss of energy .
#Text=Unplug electronic devices from their socket when not in use .
#Text=When you are not using television , computers , music systems , and other electronic devices , always remember to unplug them .
#Text=Most of us do n't realize that when these electronic devices are left in their standby mode , they still consume energy .
#Text=Decorate your living space with natural products .
#Text=If you want to make your apartment look better or think that it needs a facelift , you can use natural products to decorate it .
#Text=Use mats made from bamboo or corks .
#Text=Put indoor plants in different areas of your home .
#Text=You can hang plant pots from your balcony too .
#Text=Not only will they clean the air inside the apartment but will also add to its aesthetic appeal .
#Text=Clean your apartment with re-usable cloths .
#Text=Opt for micro-fibre cloths instead of synthetic brushes and cleansers .
#Text=Soak the cloth in water and then use it if you want to remove hard stains from surfaces , such as table tops , glass , and window panes .
